questions.question: The most applicable failure theory for metals like aluminium is
questions.explanation: The most applicable failure theory for ductile materials is the Maximum Distortion Energy Theory (von Mises). For brittle materials, the Maximum Principal Stress Theory is used.

questions.question: Which one of the following is FALSE?
options: Number of Taps generally used for hand taping is 3
Piispanen's model in machining is used to estimate shear strain
Chip hammering during machining is due to improper chip control
Cemented carbide tools are generally poor in compression
questions.answer: Cemented carbide tools are generally poor in compression
questions.explanation: Cemented carbide tools have very high compressive strength but are generally poor in shear. The statement that they are poor in compression is false.

questions.question: A statistical process control chart which shows the number of defects found in a subgroup of fixed size is
questions.explanation: A C-chart is an attributes control chart used for monitoring the number of defects per unit when the sample size is fixed.

questions.question: Complex irregular three dimensional surfaces can be located using the following method
questions.explanation: Nesting locators position a part by enclosing it in a recess of the same shape, making it the most accurate method for complex irregular 3-D surfaces.

questions.question: The force in member BC of steel truss structure shown in figure below is (Cross section of each member is A, Length of each member is 'l')
questions.explanation: By taking moments about point G for the right-hand side of the section, F_BC × l = 2P₁ × l + P₂ × 2l, which simplifies to F_BC = 2P₁ + 2P₂ = 2(P₁ + P₂).

questions.question: Buckling loads (Pi) of 4 columns of equal length and cross section, but with different end conditions are shown below. Which of the following is TRUE?
questions.explanation: The buckling loads are: Pr(fixed-free) = π²EI/4l², Pp(hinged-hinged) = π²EI/l², Ps(fixed-hinged) = 2π²EI/l², Pq(fixed-fixed) = 4π²EI/l². The correct increasing order is Pr < Pp < Ps < Pq.

questions.question: The bar AB weighs 10 kg per meter and is supported by cable AC and a pin at B. Reaction at B is (take g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation: The total weight of the rod is 10 kg/m * 2m * 10 m/s² = 200 N acting at the center. Taking moments about B, Tsin(30) * 2 - 200 * 1 = 0, so T = 200 N. Summing forces, R_BV = 100 N and R_BH = 173.2 N. The resultant reaction is 200 N at 30° to the horizontal.

questions.question: Arrange the metals Aluminium, Copper, Iron & Silver in increasing order of thermal conductivity
questions.explanation: The approximate thermal conductivities are: Iron (55-35), Aluminium (210), Copper (385), Silver (410). The correct increasing order is Iron < Aluminium < Copper < Silver.

questions.question: Modulus of resilience for the material shown in the stress-strain diagram is
questions.explanation: Modulus of resilience is the area under the stress-strain curve up to the elastic limit. Area = 0.5 * stress * strain = 0.5 * 200 N/mm² * 0.001 = 0.1 N/mm² = 0.1 * 10⁶ N/m² = 100 kN/m².

questions.question: Which of the following is FALSE?
options: Heat flow by conduction is directly proportional to the area and temperature gradient
Heat flow by convection is directly proportional to the area and temperature difference
Heat flow by radiation is directly proportional to the cube of absolute temperature of the radiating body
Emissivity of a perfect black body is unity
questions.answer: Heat flow by radiation is directly proportional to the cube of absolute temperature of the radiating body
questions.explanation: Heat flow by radiation is directly proportional to the fourth power of the absolute temperature (Stefan-Boltzmann Law), not the cube.

questions.question: Two dimensionally equal blocks of material M1 and M2 are placed on a flat surface with Young's moduli E1 > E2. A uniform pressure 'p' is applied. Which of the following statements are correct? (p) Stress in both blocks are same (q) Strain in both blocks are same (r) Plate AB tilts and point B moves downward (s) Plate AB tilts and point A moves downward.
questions.explanation: Since pressure 'p' is uniform and blocks are dimensionally equal, the stress (P/A) is the same in both (p is correct). Since E1 > E2, strain (stress/E) will be different. Strain in M2 will be greater than M1, so block M2 will compress more, causing point B to move downward (r is correct).

questions.question: In tolerancing of a part, unless otherwise specified, individual features of size must
options: not violate size limits of MMC at any cross section
not violate an envelope of perfect form at LMC
not violate an envelope of perfect form at MMC
questions.answer: not violate an envelope of perfect form at MMC
questions.explanation: This is Taylor's principle of gauging. It ensures that a feature at its Maximum Material Condition (MMC) will have perfect form, which is critical for interchangeability.

questions.question: A rigid horizontal bar AB is supported by two wires CE & DF of lengths L and 2L. If each wire has cross-sectional area A, the tensile stresses σ₁ (in CE) and σ₂ (in DF) are respectively.
questions.explanation: From the geometry of similar triangles formed by deflection, Δ₂ = 2Δ₁. Since Δ = PL/AE, we get (P₂*2L)/AE = 2 * (P₁*L)/AE, which simplifies to P₂ = P₁. From moment equilibrium about A, 3P = P₁ + 2P₂. Substituting P₁=P₂ gives 3P = 3P₁, so P₁=P₂=P. Stress = P/A for both.

questions.question: A 3 m long steel shaft has to transmit 7.5 kW at 3600 rpm. Required shaft diameter is given by (Take allowable shear stress = 100 N/mm², π² = 10)?
questions.explanation: Power P = 2πNT/60, so Torque T = (7500 * 60) / (2π * 3600) ≈ 375/(6π) N-m. From the torsion equation T/J = τ/r, and J = πd⁴/32, we get T = (τ * πd³)/16. Solving for d³, d³ = (16T)/(πτ) = (16 * 375*10³ / (6π)) / (π * 100). With π²=10, d³ ≈ 1000 mm³. So, d = 10 mm.

questions.question: For thin cylindrical shell structures loaded in compression, the design is based on
questions.explanation: Thin and long cylindrical structures under axial compression are prone to failure by buckling before they reach their yield strength. Therefore, buckling strength is the controlling design consideration.

questions.question: The frictional shear stress (τ) in metal forming is expressed as (where m is friction shear factor and σ is flow stress)
questions.explanation: The relationship between flow stress in uniaxial tension and shear flow stress according to the Tresca friction model is given by τ = mσ/√3.

questions.question: Governing differential equation for small deflections of elastic beams is given by
questions.explanation: All three equations are part of the governing differential equations for elastic beams, representing bending moment, shear force, and distributed load respectively.

questions.question: A point moves according to the relation x = 8t² cos(ωt), y = -4t³ sin(ωt), where x and y are in meters, and t in seconds. If angular velocity ω = 8π rad/sec, the velocity vector of the point at t = 0.5 sec is given by
questions.explanation: Differentiating x and y with respect to t gives velocity components u and v. At t=0.5s, ωt = 4π. Since sin(4π)=0 and cos(4π)=1, the velocity vector V = [16t cos(ωt) - 8t²ω sin(ωt)]i + [-12t² sin(ωt) - 4t³ω cos(ωt)]j simplifies to V = (16*0.5*1 - 0)i + (0 - 4*(0.5)³*8π*1)j = 8i - 4πj.

questions.question: A 10 mm thick plate is welded to another plate using a 10 mm fillet weld on two sides. An end load of 1 kN acts on the plate. The primary shear stress produced in the throat is
questions.explanation: The weld length is 30mm (from the diagram). Primary shear stress = Load / (2 * length * throat_thickness). Throat thickness 't' = size * cos(45). The formula given in the solution P√2 / (2bs) seems to simplify this calculation where s=size. Stress = 1000 / (2 * 30 * 0.707 * 10) = 2.35 N/mm², which is close to 2.4 N/mm².

questions.question: Isochoric changes in ideal gas are characterized by
questions.explanation: An isochoric process is a constant volume process. From the ideal gas law PV=nRT, if V is constant, then P/T = nR/V = constant.

questions.question: A cantilever beam of length 'L' has natural frequency ω₁. If the beam is broken into halves, the natural frequency of the remaining cantilever beam ω₂ will be such that
options: Cannot be obtained from the given data
questions.explanation: Natural frequency ω is proportional to √(k/m). Stiffness k of a cantilever is proportional to EI/L³. If L becomes L/2, stiffness k becomes 8 times the original. Frequency is proportional to √k, so it increases. ω is inversely proportional to L², so halving the length increases the frequency by a factor of 4. The provided solution notes ω ∝ 1/L^(3/2), which also leads to an increase.

questions.question: In CAD, if the transformation matrix T is diagonal, then the transformation is called
questions.explanation: A diagonal transformation matrix in homogeneous coordinates represents scaling. The diagonal elements correspond to the scaling factors along each axis.

questions.question: A water tank is located 3 m above ground and depth of water in tank is 2 m. Exit pipe is 50 mm in dia and 50 m long. Velocity of water at the exit at the ground level is
options: This question is excluded for evaluation by the ISRO.
questions.answer: This question is excluded for evaluation by the ISRO.
questions.explanation: This question was officially excluded from evaluation, likely due to missing information (e.g., pipe friction factor) or ambiguity.

questions.question: The work ratio of a gas turbine is a function of
questions.explanation: The work ratio (Net Work / Turbine Work) of a Brayton cycle depends on both the pressure ratio and the temperature ratio (max temp / min temp).

questions.question: The temperature distribution across a 1m thick concrete wall is T = 150 - 80x + 16x². With k=0.6 W/mK and A=10 m², the heat accumulated in unit time is
questions.explanation: Heat accumulated = Heat in - Heat out. Heat flux q = -kA(dT/dx). dT/dx = -80+32x. q_in (at x=0) = -0.6 * 10 * (-80) = 480 W. q_out (at x=1) = -0.6 * 10 * (-80+32) = 288 W. Heat accumulated = 480 - 288 = 192 J/sec.

questions.question: Which one of the following is the permanent mould casting process?
questions.explanation: Die casting is a process that uses a reusable mold (a die), making it a permanent mould casting process. The others listed use expendable molds.

questions.question: Identify the geometric characteristic that describe the feature geometry and the inter-relationship of part features
questions.explanation: The four fundamental geometric characteristics are size, form, orientation, and location. Form describes the shape of a feature (e.g., flatness, straightness).

questions.question: Isothermal compressibility of an ideal gas in
questions.explanation: Isothermal compressibility is k_T = (-1/V)(∂V/∂P)_T. For an ideal gas, V = nRT/P. So, (∂V/∂P)_T = -nRT/P². Thus, k_T = (-1/V)(-nRT/P²) = nRT/(VP²).

questions.question: Datum features on the part are
questions.explanation: Datums can be permanent features of the final part or temporary features used during manufacturing that may be removed or altered later.

questions.question: The eigen values of A = [[2, 2, 4], [2, -1, 2], [4, 2, 2]] are.
questions.explanation: The characteristic equation is |A - λI| = 0. Solving the resulting cubic equation (λ+2)(λ²-5λ-14)=0 gives the eigenvalues λ=-2, λ=-2, and λ=7.

questions.question: In process charts, the symbol used for inspection is
questions.explanation: In process flow charts, a square symbol represents an inspection step, where an object is checked for its quality or quantity.

questions.question: Efficiency of gas turbines lies between
questions.explanation: Practical gas turbines, especially older or simple cycle designs, have a relatively low thermal efficiency, typically in the range of 15% to 25%.

questions.question: Which one of the following is an impulse turbine?
questions.explanation: A Pelton turbine is an impulse turbine where the pressure of the fluid remains constant as it passes over the buckets. Francis and Kaplan turbines are reaction turbines.

questions.question: Which of the following is FALSE for bolted joints?
options: Bolted joints are preloaded to avoid vibration loosening
Threads made by thread rolling are preferred over machined threads
When external load is applied, a bigger percentage relieves flange compression and the rest increases bolt tension
Bolted joints are designed such that bolt stiffness is higher than flange stiffness
questions.answer: Bolted joints are designed such that bolt stiffness is higher than flange stiffness
questions.explanation: For a preloaded bolted joint, it is desirable for the flange stiffness to be much higher than the bolt stiffness to minimize the increase in bolt tension under external load.

questions.question: Root opening of a Single Vee groove weld joint of plate thickness 't' is
questions.explanation: As per standard welding code provisions, the root opening for a single Vee groove weld is typically around t/4 to allow for proper penetration.

questions.question: A cubic B-spline curve requires a minimum of ______ control points.
questions.explanation: A B-spline curve of degree 'n' (cubic is degree 3) requires at least n+1 control points. Therefore, a cubic B-spline requires a minimum of 4 control points.

questions.question: Transportation method is concerned with
questions.explanation: The transportation problem is a classic application of linear programming, used to find the most efficient routes to transport goods from sources to destinations.

questions.question: The reaction in which a liquid phase transforms into two different solid phases is called
questions.explanation: A eutectic reaction is an invariant reaction where a liquid phase transforms into two solid phases upon cooling (Liquid → Solid 1 + Solid 2).

questions.question: Margin wear in a drill is due to
questions.explanation: Margin and crater wear are primarily caused by excessive heat leading to thermal softening of the tool material, while flank wear is due to abrasion.

questions.question: The specific speed of the Kaplan turbine is
questions.explanation: The Kaplan turbine has a very high specific speed, typically in the range of 600 to 1000, making it suitable for low head and high flow rate applications.

questions.question: If f(t) = e^(at), its Laplace Transform (for s > a) is given by
questions.explanation: The Laplace transform of e^(at) is defined as the integral from 0 to infinity of e^(at) * e^(-st) dt, which evaluates to 1/(s-a).

questions.question: Smallest thickness which can be measured by a slip gauge is
questions.explanation: Standard slip gauge sets (like M112) can create dimensions in steps of 0.001 mm, but the smallest single gauge is typically 1.001 mm.

questions.question: The deflection of an elastic member at the point of application of a force in the direction of that force is given by the derivative of member's total strain energy taken with respect to the applied force. This is known as
options: Principle of conservation of strain energy
questions.explanation: This is the statement of Castigliano's first theorem, which relates the partial derivative of strain energy with respect to a force to the displacement at the point of application of that force.

questions.question: Thumb rule between feed and nose radius in rough turning is
questions.explanation: A common rule of thumb for connecting feed (f) and nose radius (r) in rough turning operations is f (mm/rev) ≈ 0.5 × Nose radius.

questions.question: Which of the following is FALSE?
options: A reverted gear train is one in which the first and last gears are on the same axis.
Train value for a gear is the ratio of product of driven tooth numbers to product of driving tooth numbers.
A planetary gear train is one in which the axes of some of the gears may have a motion.
A compound gear train is one which has two or more gears on each axis.
questions.answer: Train value for a gear is the ratio of product of driven tooth numbers to product of driving tooth numbers.
questions.explanation: Train value is the reciprocal of the speed ratio. It is defined as the ratio of the product of driving tooth numbers to the product of driven tooth numbers.

questions.question: Which of the following is true for ductile materials?
options: Engineering stress-strain curve cannot have negative slope
Most applicable failure theory is maximum principal stress theory
Ultimate strain is the strain at ultimate stress
Strain hardening is represented by a negative slope in engineering stress strain curve
questions.answer: Ultimate strain is the strain at ultimate stress
questions.explanation: The ultimate strain corresponds to the point of ultimate tensile stress (UTS) on the stress-strain curve. Statements (a), (b), and (d) are incorrect.

questions.question: The specific metal cutting energy is expressed as (where α is rake angle, β is friction angle, φ is shear angle and τ is shear stress)
questions.explanation: Specific cutting energy (Uc) is the cutting force (Fc) per unit material removal rate (MRR). The expression for Fc derived from Merchant's circle analysis leads to this formula for Uc.

questions.question: For isotropic materials, the modulus of Elasticity in tension and shear (E and G) are related to the Poisson's ratio (v) as follows
questions.explanation: The relationship between Young's Modulus (E), Shear Modulus (G), and Poisson's ratio (v) for an isotropic material is E = 2G(1+v), which can be rearranged to G = E / 2(1+v).

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT true?
options: For direct impact of two bodies, coefficient of restitution is the ratio of relative velocity of approach to their relative velocity of separation
Conservation of angular momentum implies that total angular momentum remains constant unless acted on by an external torque
Conservation of linear momentum implies that the sum of external forces in that direction is zero
The coefficient of friction is independent of area of contact
questions.answer: For direct impact of two bodies, coefficient of restitution is the ratio of relative velocity of approach to their relative velocity of separation
questions.explanation: The coefficient of restitution is the ratio of the relative velocity of separation to the relative velocity of approach, not the other way around.

questions.question: A block (4x3 m size) of 20 kg mass rests on a flat horizontal surface. If the coefficient of friction is 1/4, the force 'F' which will cause the block to move is approximately
questions.explanation: The normal force N = mg - Fsin(30). Friction force f = μN = 0.25(200 - 0.5F). For motion, Fcos(30) > f. So, 0.866F > 50 - 0.125F. This gives 0.991F > 50, so F > 50.45 N, which is approximately 5.04 kgf.

questions.question: A point P moves along the path y = x² – 4. What is the displacement when the point moves from x = 1 to x = 3?
questions.explanation: At x₁=1, y₁ = 1²-4 = -3. At x₂=3, y₂ = 3²-4 = 5. Displacement = √((x₂-x₁)² + (y₂-y₁)² ) = √((3-1)² + (5-(-3))²) = √(2² + 8²) = √68 ≈ 8.24. The angle is tan⁻¹((y₂-y₁)/(x₂-x₁)) = tan⁻¹(8/2) = tan⁻¹(4).

questions.question: The pulley system has a mass of 1.5 kg and radius of gyration of 0.2 m. The angular acceleration of the pulleys, when the suspended masses are released is
questions.explanation: The total moment of inertia I_total = I₁ + I₂ + I₃ = 0.06 + 0.04 + 0.03 = 0.13 kg-m². The net torque τ = m₃gr₃ - m₂gr₂ = 3*10*0.1 - 1*10*0.2 = 3 - 2 = 1 N-m. Angular acceleration α = τ / I_total = 1 / 0.13 = 100/13 ≈ 10/1.3 rad/sec².

questions.question: A U tube manometer is used to measure the gauge pressure of water (density = 1000 kg/m³). If the density of manometer liquid is 12000 kg/m³, h1 = 0.5m & h2 = 1.0m, gauge pressure at 'A' is
questions.explanation: Balancing pressures at the interface: P_A + ρ₁gh₁ = P₀ + ρ₂gh₂. For gauge pressure, P₀=0. P_A = ρ₂gh₂ - ρ₁gh₁ = (12000*10*1.0) - (1000*10*0.5) = 120000 - 5000 = 115000 Pa = 115 kPa.

questions.question: A man draws 3 balls from a jug containing 5 white and 7 black balls. He gets Rs. 20 for each white ball and Rs. 10 for each black ball. What is his expectation?
questions.explanation: This requires calculating the expected value by summing the product of each outcome's value and its probability. The calculation results in an expected value of Rs. 42.50.

questions.question: The missing dimension in the following simple part is
questions.explanation: This is a tolerance stack-up problem. AB_avg = 57 - 17 - 17.5 - 11 = 11.5. The tolerance is the sum of individual tolerances: 1.5(CD)+0.5(EA)+0.5(GF)+0.5(BG) = 3.5. So, AB = 11.5 ± 3.5.

questions.question: Which one of the following is FALSE about Boronizing process?
options: it can be done only on high carbon steels
it is used to obtain extremely high wear resistant surfaces
questions.answer: it can be done only on high carbon steels
questions.explanation: Boronizing (or boriding) can be applied to a wide range of materials, including low-carbon steels, tool steels, and nickel-based alloys, not just high-carbon steels.

questions.question: In dynamic balancing of machines, which of the following is NOT a method of measuring the magnitude and location of correction weight for a two plane correction?
questions.explanation: Pivoted compensation method is not a standard recognized method for dynamic balancing. The other three are established techniques.

questions.question: The stress produced in a wire of diameter 6 mm, when it is bent around a large cylinder of diameter 2 m can be obtained as (Young's modulus = 200 GPa)
questions.explanation: The bending stress is σ = E * y / R. Here, y = d/2 = 3 mm, and R = D/2 = 1000 mm. σ = 200,000 MPa * 3 / 1000 = 600 MPa. However, the stress-strain curve shows a yield point at 300 MPa. The wire will yield, and the stress will be limited to 300 MPa.

questions.question: The critical pressure ratio for maximum discharge in a steam nozzle is (where 'γ' is the isentropic index)
questions.explanation: The critical pressure ratio (P*/P₀) for isentropic flow through a nozzle that maximizes the mass flow rate is given by the formula (2/(γ+1))^(γ/(γ-1)).

questions.question: The type of locator used to prevent jamming during locating of a work piece is
questions.explanation: Spherical locators have a small contact area, which prevents jamming and binding, especially when locating from holes or internal features.

questions.question: A carton carrying vessel of mass 10 tons floats on water. If the vessel tilts by 0.01 radians by moving a 50 kg carton from the centre by 2m, the metacentric height is
questions.explanation: The tilting moment is w * x = 50kg * 10m/s² * 2m = 1000 N-m. The restoring moment is W * GM * sin(θ) ≈ W * GM * θ. Equating them, 1000 = (10,000kg * 10m/s²) * GM * 0.01. This gives GM = 1000 / 1000 = 1 m.

questions.question: The maximum value of reduction in rolling process is (Where 'D' is roll diameter and 'α' is the angle of bite)
questions.answer: This question is excluded for evaluation by the ISRO.
questions.explanation: The correct formula for draft or reduction (Δh) is Δh = 2R(1-cosα) or D(1-cosα). The options seem to be variations of this, but the question was excluded from evaluation by ISRO, likely due to ambiguity or errors in the options.

questions.question: Which of the following is TRUE for vibration of a mechanical system
options: Damping ratio is the ratio of the critical damping to the actual damping
The damping can be obtained using logarithmic decrement method
For damped systems, amplitude becomes infinity at resonance
Amplitude ratio is unity when the exciting force frequency is √2 times the natural frequency
questions.answer: Amplitude ratio is unity when the exciting force frequency is √2 times the natural frequency
questions.explanation: (d) is correct. For a transmissibility calculation, when the frequency ratio (ω/ωn) is √2, the transmissibility T.R. becomes 1, regardless of the damping ratio.

questions.question: What is the maximum rate that a heat pump which uses 1 kW of electric power can supply heat to a house at 27°C when the outside temperature is 12°C
questions.explanation: The maximum Coefficient of Performance (COP) for a heat pump is given by T_H / (T_H - T_L), where temperatures are in Kelvin. T_H = 27+273=300K, T_L = 12+273=285K. COP = 300 / (300-285) = 20. The rate of heat supply Q_H = COP * W_in = 20 * 1 kW = 20 kW = 20 kJ/s.

questions.question: Evaluate the integral ∫∫(1-x²)^(-1/2) (1-y²)^(-1/2) dx dy over the region x=0 to 1, y=0 to 1.
questions.explanation: The double integral is separable: [∫(1-x²)^(-1/2) dx] * [∫(1-y²)^(-1/2) dy]. The integral of (1-t²)^(-1/2) is sin⁻¹(t). Evaluating from 0 to 1 gives sin⁻¹(1) - sin⁻¹(0) = π/2. Since both integrals are identical, the result is (π/2) * (π/2) = π²/4.

questions.question: White iron structure consists of
questions.explanation: The structure of white cast iron consists of pearlite and a large amount of cementite (iron carbide), often in a eutectic mixture called ledeburite. This high cementite content makes it very hard and brittle.

questions.question: A cantilever beam of rectangular cross section (d x b) is subjected to a shear force 'F'. Which of the following is TRUE?
options: The beam has a uniform shear stress F/bd
Maximum shear stress and maximum bending stress are equal when L=d/2
For L > d/2, bending stress decides the failure
questions.answer: For L > d/2, bending stress decides the failure
questions.explanation: The maximum shear stress is 1.5 * (F/A) and the maximum bending stress is (FL * d/2) / I. As the length L increases, the bending stress increases linearly while the shear stress remains constant, making bending the dominant failure mode for longer beams.

questions.question: A jet engine consumes 1 kg of fuel for each 40 kg of air. Fuel consumption is 1 kg/sec. When aircraft travels at 200 m/sec, velocity of discharge gases is 700 m/sec. The power developed by the engine is
Which of the following is most appropriate for vapour power cycles?
options: In Carnot cycle, expansion of vapour occurs without change in entropy
In Rankine cycle, transformation of liquid water in steam generator occurs at constant temperature
In Carnot cycle heating of vapor occurs at constant volume
In Rankine cycle, entropy of vapor increases during its expansion in steam turbine
questions.answer: In Carnot cycle, expansion of vapour occurs without change in entropy
questions.explanation: The expansion and compression processes in a Carnot cycle are isentropic (constant entropy). The other statements are incorrect descriptions of Rankine and Carnot cycles.

questions.question: The Load Vs Displacement curve shown in the figure pertains to
questions.explanation: The curve shows an initial increase in force, followed by a sharp drop after the material fractures. This characteristic shape is typical of a shearing operation like blanking.

questions.question: The reheat factor Rf for a steam turbine is usually in the range of
questions.explanation: The reheat factor represents the increase in cumulative enthalpy drop due to reheating, which makes it slightly greater than 1, typically in the range of 1.02 to 1.06.

questions.question: Adaptive response rate forecasting is related to
questions.explanation: Adaptive response rate forecasting is a technique for estimating demand in inventory control systems, particularly for items with changing demand patterns.

questions.question: Process in which lowest tolerances in cast products of ferrous and non ferrous metals can be achieved is
questions.explanation: Investment casting (also known as lost-wax casting) is capable of producing parts with very high dimensional accuracy and tight tolerances, superior to other casting methods.

questions.question: Pickling treatment is cleaning the casting with
questions.explanation: Pickling is a metal surface treatment that uses a dilute acid solution (pickle liquor) to remove impurities like stains, rust, or scale.

questions.question: Element which makes steel stainless
questions.explanation: Chromium (Cr) is the key alloying element that makes steel 'stainless' by forming a passive, corrosion-resistant chromium oxide layer on the surface. A minimum of 10.5% Cr is required.

questions.question: Isentropic process is related to
questions.explanation: An isentropic process is one that is both adiabatic (no heat transfer) and reversible (no entropy generation). This combination results in a constant entropy process.

questions.question: Tolerances generally followed for tooling design are
questions.explanation: Tooling and gauge design often follows the 'rule of ten', where the gauge tolerance is 10% of the workpiece tolerance. However, for tooling design itself, a wider range such as 31-50% is often cited in textbooks.

questions.question: Which of the following is FALSE about Normal distribution?
options: Normal Distribution is applied for discrete Random Distribution
The shape of the Normal Curve is Bell Shaped
The area under a standard normal curve is 1
The standard normal curve is symmetric about the value 0
questions.answer: Normal Distribution is applied for discrete Random Distribution
questions.explanation: The Normal Distribution is used for continuous random variables, not discrete ones. Distributions like the Binomial or Poisson are used for discrete variables.

questions.question: The temperature of the products of combustion when the maximum amount of chemical energy is converted to thermal energy is
questions.explanation: The adiabatic flame temperature is the maximum possible temperature achieved for a given fuel and oxidizer, which occurs when the combustion is complete (stoichiometric) and there are no heat losses.

questions.question: Fredric W Taylor introduced a system of working known as
questions.explanation: F.W. Taylor, the father of scientific management, advocated for functional organization, where workers receive orders from several different specialist supervisors, each with expertise in a specific area.
